member.name: T:C9Native.BaseFileHandle
member.summary: Wrapper with RAII constructor for opening a read only native file handle.

member.name: P:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.Handle
member.summary: Handle that will be filled in by the CTOR and used subsequently.

member.name: P:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.Status
member.summary: Retrieve completion status information if there is a failure.

member.name: P:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.IsOk
member.summary: Return true if this object was loaded successfully.

member.name: F:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.InvalidHandleValue
member.summary: Invalid handle value for comparison.

member.name: F:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.NullHandleValue
member.summary: Null handle value for comparison.

member.name: P:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.Path
member.summary: Return the path that was used to open this file handle.

member.name: M:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.ReadOnlyHandleFactory(System.String)
member.summary: Factory for read only file handles.
member.param: Path to the file that we want a native handle for.

member.name: M:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.#ctor(System.String,C9Native.BaseFileHandle.EFileAccess,C9Native.BaseFileHandle.EFileShare,System.IntPtr,C9Native.BaseFileHandle.ECreationDisposition,C9Native.BaseFileHandle.EFileAttributes,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Base native handle constructor. Call up from 'live' class.
member.param: Path to file that we want a handle to
Access parameters
Sharing access
Security descriptor
Creation parameters
File attributes if we create a new file
Template file

member.name: M:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.Dispose
member.summary: Release native handle if we hold one. Atomic exchange so this should be thread safe.

member.name: M:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.IsHandleValid(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Return true if this object contains a valid handle.
member.param: handle to be checked
member.returns: true if the provided handle is valid

member.name: T:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.ECreationDisposition
member.summary: Control of file creation.

member.name: F:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.ECreationDisposition.New
member.summary: Creates a new file. The function fails if a specified file exists.

member.name: F:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.ECreationDisposition.CreateAlways
member.summary: Creates a new file, always. If a file exists, the function overwrites the file, clears the existing attributes, combines the specified file attributes, and flags with FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ARCHIVE, but does not set the security descriptor that the SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure specifies.

member.name: F:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.ECreationDisposition.OpenExisting
member.summary: Opens a file. The function fails if the file does not exist.

member.name: F:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.ECreationDisposition.OpenAlways
member.summary: Opens a file, always. If a file does not exist, the function creates a file as if dwCreationDisposition is CREATE_NEW.

member.name: F:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.ECreationDisposition.TruncateExisting
member.summary: Opens a file and truncates it so that its size is 0 (zero) bytes. The function fails if the file does not exist. The calling process must open the file with the GENERIC_WRITE access right.

member.name: T:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.EFileAttributes
member.summary: Flags for control of attributes.

member.name: T:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.EFileShare
member.summary: Flags that control sharing.

member.name: F:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.EFileShare.Read
member.summary: Enables subsequent open operations on an object to request read access. Otherwise, other processes cannot open the object if they request read access. If this flag is not specified, but the object has been opened for read access, the function fails.

member.name: F:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.EFileShare.Write
member.summary: Enables subsequent open operations on an object to request write access. Otherwise, other processes cannot open the object if they request write access. If this flag is not specified, but the object has been opened for write access, the function fails.

member.name: F:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.EFileShare.Delete
member.summary: Enables subsequent open operations on an object to request delete access. Otherwise, other processes cannot open the object if they request delete access. If this flag is not specified, but the object has been opened for delete access, the function fails.

member.name: T:C9Native.BaseFileHandle.EFileAccess
member.summary: Flags controlling access

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.CasePreservedNames
member.summary: The file system preserves the case of file names when it places a name on disk.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.CaseSensitiveSearch
member.summary: The file system supports case-sensitive file names.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.DaxVolume
member.summary: The specified volume is a direct access (DAX) volume. This flag was introduced in Windows 10, version 1607.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.FileCompression
member.summary: The file system supports file-based compression.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.NamedStreams
member.summary: The file system supports named streams.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.PersistentACLS
member.summary: The file system preserves and enforces access control lists (ACL).

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.ReadOnlyVolume
member.summary: The specified volume is read-only.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.SequentialWriteOnce
member.summary: The volume supports a single sequential write.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.SupportsEncryption
member.summary: The file system supports the Encrypted File System (EFS).

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.SupportsExtendedAttributes
member.summary: The specified volume supports extended attributes. An extended attribute is a piece of application-specific metadata that an application can associate with a file and is not part of the file's data.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.SupportsHardLinks
member.summary: The specified volume supports hard links. For more information, see Hard Links and Junctions.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.SupportsObjectIDs
member.summary: The file system supports object identifiers.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.SupportsOpenByFileId
member.summary: The file system supports open by FileID. For more information, see FILE_ID_BOTH_DIR_INFO.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.SupportsReparsePoints
member.summary: The file system supports re-parse points.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.SupportsSparseFiles
member.summary: The file system supports sparse files.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.SupportsTransactions
member.summary: The volume supports transactions.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.SupportsUsnJournal
member.summary: The specified volume supports update sequence number (USN) journals. For more information, see Change Journal Records.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.UnicodeOnDisk
member.summary: The file system supports Unicode in file names as they appear on disk.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.VolumeIsCompressed
member.summary: The specified volume is a compressed volume, for example, a DoubleSpace volume.

member.name: F:C9Native.FileSystemFeature.VolumeQuotas
member.summary: The file system supports disk quotas.

member.summary: Output data layout for GetFileInformationByHandleExW(...) with

member.name: F:C9Native.GetFileInformation.EFileShare.Read
member.summary: Enables subsequent open operations on an object to request read access. Otherwise, other processes cannot open the object if they request read access. If this flag is not specified, but the object has been opened for read access, the function fails.

member.name: F:C9Native.GetFileInformation.EFileShare.Write
member.summary: Enables subsequent open operations on an object to request write access. Otherwise, other processes cannot open the object if they request write access. If this flag is not specified, but the object has been opened for write access, the function fails.

member.name: F:C9Native.GetFileInformation.EFileShare.Delete
member.summary: Enables subsequent open operations on an object to request delete access. Otherwise, other processes cannot open the object if they request delete access. If this flag is not specified, but the object has been opened for delete access, the function fails.

member.summary: Creates a new file. The function fails if a specified file exists.

member.name: F:C9Native.GetFileInformation.ECreationDisposition.CreateAlways
member.summary: Creates a new file, always. If a file exists, the function overwrites the file, clears the existing attributes, combines the specified file attributes, and flags with FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ARCHIVE, but does not set the security descriptor that the SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure specifies.

member.summary: Opens a file. The function fails if the file does not exist.

member.name: F:C9Native.GetFileInformation.ECreationDisposition.OpenAlways
member.summary: Opens a file, always. If a file does not exist, the function creates a file as if dwCreationDisposition is CREATE_NEW.

member.name: F:C9Native.GetFileInformation.ECreationDisposition.TruncateExisting
member.summary: Opens a file and truncates it so that its size is 0 (zero) bytes. The function fails if the file does not exist. The calling process must open the file with the GENERIC_WRITE access right.

member.name: T:C9Native.FileInformationFileId
member.summary: Retrieve the unique file ID for this file.

member.name: P:C9Native.FileInformationFileId.Status
member.summary: Return the failure status if any or null if object creation succeeded.

member.name: P:C9Native.FileInformationFileId.IsOk
member.summary: Returns true if the construction succeeded. If false then Status will return the failure information.

member.name: P:C9Native.FileInformationFileId.Path
member.summary: Retrieve the path passed in on object creation.

member.name: M:C9Native.FileInformationFileId.GetSerialNumber(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the two 32 bit pieces of the volume serial number part of the file id.
member.param: Index 0 or 1 to the piece of the volume serial number that is of interest.
member.returns: 32 bit piece of the volume serial number.

member.name: P:C9Native.FileInformationFileId.FullSerialNumber
member.summary: Retrieve a string form of the full 64 bit volume serial number.

member.name: P:C9Native.FileInformationFileId.VolumeSerialNumber
member.summary: Retrieve the 32 bit volume serial number.

member.name: M:C9Native.FileInformationFileId.GetFileIdentifier(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieve the four 32 bit pieces of the file identifier.
member.param: Index 0..3 of the piece of the file identifier of interest.
member.returns: 32 bit piece of the file identifier.

member.name: P:C9Native.FileInformationFileId.Identifier
member.summary: Retrieve the file specific identifier. Needs to be combined with the volume serial number to be unique.

member.name: P:C9Native.FileInformationFileId.FullIdentifier
member.summary: Return the full string that identifies this file containing both volume information and file information.

member.name: M:C9Native.FileInformationFileId.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: RAII CTOR Retrieve the pieces of the file identifier.
member.param: Path to the file we're interested in.

member.name: M:C9Native.FileInformationFileId.#ctor(C9Native.BaseFileHandle)
member.summary: Get the unique file identifier for the file associated with the provided handle. This version uses a pre-opened handle.
member.param: Wrapper object around a native file handle.

member.name: M:C9Native.FileInformationFileId.LoadValues(C9Native.BaseFileHandle)
member.summary: Fill in the contents of this object. Factored out common code from the file path and native handle based versions.
member.param: Native handle in wrapper for the file to be examined.

member.name: T:C9Native.VolumePathNames
member.summary: RAII Retrieve mounted paths for the provided volume.

member.summary: The name of the volume we were asked to get mount paths for.

member.summary: Retrieve one of the paths that this volume is mounted at.

member.returns: the string that represents one of the mount paths for this volume

member.summary: Property that provides the number of paths stored here.

member.summary: Provide read only access to the name of the volume we grabbed the mount paths for.

member.name: P:C9Native.VolumePathNames.Status
member.summary: Return the completion status code for this retrieval.

member.name: M:C9Native.VolumePathNames.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Construct object loaded with the paths (zero or more) associated with this volume.

member.summary: RAII Get a list of _volumes and the available detailed volume information.

member.summary: Retrieve one of the volume names stored in this object.

member.summary: Retrieve the volume information for one volume we know about.

member.name: T:C9Native.VolumeSpace
member.summary: Given a volume path, RAII provide the capacity information for the volume.

member.name: P:C9Native.VolumeSpace.VolumePath
member.summary: Retrieve the volume path that this object was created for.

member.name: P:C9Native.VolumeSpace.AvailableBytes
member.summary: Return the number of bytes available to the current user.

member.name: P:C9Native.VolumeSpace.AvailableText
member.summary: Human readable version of available space.

member.name: P:C9Native.VolumeSpace.TotalBytes
member.summary: Return the total number of bytes that the volume can store.

member.name: P:C9Native.VolumeSpace.TotalText
member.summary: Text representation of the total space on the volume.

member.name: P:C9Native.VolumeSpace.FreeBytes
member.summary: Return the number of bytes of free space on the volume.

member.name: P:C9Native.VolumeSpace.FreeText
member.summary: Text representation of the free space on the volume.

member.name: P:C9Native.VolumeSpace.Status
member.summary: Retrieve any failure status code from the setup of this object.

member.name: P:C9Native.VolumeSpace.IsOk
member.summary: Return true if the object was loaded successfully. A false result indicates error information is stored.

member.name: M:C9Native.VolumeSpace.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: RAII Style create an object holding the free space information for this volume.
member.param: Volume path for which the information is to be retrieved.

member.summary: Retrieve the volume path this was created for.

member.summary: Drive type enumeration.

member.name: F:C9Native.VolumeType.DriveType.Unknown
member.summary: The drive type cannot be determined.

member.summary: The root path is invalid, for example, no volume is mounted at the path.

member.summary: The drive is a type that has removable media, for example, a floppy drive or removable hard disk.

member.name: F:C9Native.VolumeType.DriveType.Fixed
member.summary: The drive is a type that cannot be removed, for example, a fixed hard drive.

member.name: F:C9Native.VolumeType.DriveType.Remote
member.summary: The drive is a remote (network) drive.

member.name: F:C9Native.VolumeType.DriveType.CDROM
member.summary: The drive is a CD-ROM drive.

member.name: F:C9Native.VolumeType.DriveType.RAMDisk
member.summary: The drive is a RAM disk.
